startup.notes: Application started successfully using uv run. The game window was created and initialized properly.

features_tested.description: Pygame window created with specified dimensions (800x600)
Main game loop runs at 60 FPS as configured
Targets spawn at random positions on screen
Targets shrink over time at the configured rate
Left-click detection works for clicking targets
Score increases when targets are clicked, points based on target radius
Misses are tracked when targets disappear or player clicks empty space
Game ends after 3 misses with game over screen
Press R to restart after game over

performance.notes: Game runs smoothly at configured 60 FPS. Difficulty increases over time based on score.

summary: The Reaction Reflex Test game launches and runs successfully. All core game mechanics work as expected: target spawning, shrinking, mouse click detection, scoring, miss tracking, game over state, and restart functionality. The application is a complete and playable reaction speed test game.
